line_2: To soothe thy Days, and wing thy sleepless Nights.

line_1: Pallas to read what Dalston writes:
His secret Note the troubled Henry writes,
line_2: To the known Tree the Lovely Maid invites:

line_1: 'Tis not to wound, but to instruct, She writes.
line_2: Or when, more gay, her spritely Satire bites,

line_1: Philo's quick Hand in flowing Letters writes;
line_2: While faster than his costive Brain indites,

line_1: Or those which, as the Prophet writes,
line_2: Fell on the necks of AMORITES,

line_1: Glows while he reads, but trembles as he writes)
line_2: (That on weak Wings, from far, pursues your Flights;
